name: blastula
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the early stage of development of an animal, consisting of a layer of cells around a hollow space: In animals, cleavage results in the formation of a blastula. Blastulae were prepared by incubation of the fertilized eggs at room temperature for 6-10 hours. Related words
blastocyst
blastocoel
More examplesFewer examplesThe blastula gives no visible indication of the complex animal into which it will develop.Ovine eggs and blastulas look very like bovine ones in morphology and pigmentation.This simple structure, the blastula, must now be moulded by cellular activities into all the shapes that emerge during development.
